DataElement.preferredName: Patient Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Interference Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response for questions related to the use of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop malignant neoplasm that interferes as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Interference Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Therapeutic Procedure Interference Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.:The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active mali
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active malignancy requiring active treatment that interferes with protocol therapy and/or with a significant risk of clinical relapse within 12 months that would require treatment interfering with protocol therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other significant condition, currently uncontrolled by treatment, which may interfere with completion of the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have any other significant condition(s) that would make this protocol unreasonably hazardous?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, the natural history or treatment of the malignancy does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has prostate cancer with stable disease, is patient on active or prior treatment that will not interfere with current lung cancer treatment?
